data.text: I used to use Google Pay all the time and now with the new setup, it to difficult to turn off the NFC. Once you turn it on from the Wallet you have to go like 3 steps deep into the settings menu to turn it off. Gone are the days that you can easily turn it on and off from the pull down menu at the top of in the app. Until this is changed I will go back to using credit cards physically.

It's terrible compared to Google Pay. Doesn't allow for locking the app (apart from the device screen lock). Send/request options gone, as well as tracking. This seems to be a complete jump backward. I'll be uninstalling and continuing to use Google Pay until it goes away in June. If Google Wallet hasn't improved by then, it'll probably be time to switch to Samsung Pay.

Used it to pay for a $35 tank of gas and it showed a transaction amount of over $170. Had to pull up my card details to make sure it didn't over charge. (It didn't). This glitch combined with the lack of security settings (a review and confirmation screen, option to re-enter pin or fingerprint to confirm) these are basic security settings. Google, once a giant has fallen so far.

Still can't add custom Loyalty cards easily in the GOOGLE WALLET app. The workflow is to "take a picture" and use the image to create the custom Loyalty card. Can't comment on the pay portion. I haven't used it in years. It never "just worked" so I gave up and use the card. At one point, the payment wouldn't work with the Android setting "Require device unlock for NFC". No idea if that ever got fixed. Probably not.
data.replyText: That’s not the experience we want you to have. In this case, we would encourage you to contact our support team directly: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Many greetings.

data.text: Google Wallet is great when it works. But, several times, for no apparent reason, it has stopped working. I use it for my public transit card and have been left numerous times with no way to pay with plenty of money on the card. It is very frustrating and embarrassing. Today, I checked every setting and checked for updates. Everything is set correctly, but Wallet still won't work.
data.replyText: Sorry about that, Talayah. Could you try clearing the app's cache, data and restart your phone to see if it works fine? If the issue persists, we can help you directly here: http://goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: Great payment option until the last upgrade on 1/24. In the past you'd open the wallet and immediately need to use your fingerprint to open and use a card reader. With the new update, there isn't an option to use your fingerprint until after you put your phone towards the reader. This results in an error with the reader and your phone, stalling the payment process, waiting for the reader and your phone to clear and reset. Not a happy Google user right now. Using on a Pixel 7pro.

Requires unlock to pay, but does not display the ability to unlock when the card is tapped to pay, even if the phone is already unlocked (yes, that is how this works). Stalls the payment process 100% of the time by failing, so you have to wait for it to reset and show the unlock option. Absolutely mind boggling that an actual person designed it that way. Guess it's back to using a physical credit card. Review is for Wallet (not Pay) and in the US.
data.replyText: Sorry about that, Adam. Please let us know if you are referring to the Google Wallet or Google Pay app as well which country you're using the app in. This will help us understand how to best support you.

data.text: I have been trying to use this app on and off for about 8 months on and of while it us a very good looking app and cards are very easy to add, every time I go to pay when my phone is unlocked it gives me an error because I need to put in my finger print even thought it says the card is ready to use. This wouldn't be an issue if it prompted the user to put in their fingerprint before tapping your phone,but it doesn't, so the card reader says I need to use my physical card. Sticking to samsung pay

First time using Google wallet. If I ever find my tickets and get through this headache I will remove the Google app. This is ridiculous to go through all this headache just to view tickets. OH but you can't just make a simple button that gives you that option. It can sure give you plenty of options to view or work with money though. I want to view the tickets from ticket Master. Twice it shows downloaded, but nothing in Google. Directions are no good because those options don't exist.

Bug! I used this for 10 days on a vacation in December with no problems. But the latest update is buggy. You unlock your phone, lauch the wallet app, then tap to pay. Payment fails. The app tells you you need to unlock your phone - which you just did. So you do it. Then you try to tap to pay again. 50% of the time it fails again. A lot of the readers that have Toast or Clover do not work well when the first try fails. The Wallet app is just ridiculous to try to use now.
data.replyText: Sorry to hear that, Suruchi. In this case, we would encourage you to contact our support team directly: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Many greetings.

data.text: The wallet app on my watch stopped attempting to communicate with any POS devices a few weeks ago. Everything else works fine. No damage of any kind. Never dropped. I think it's the software as per usual. (Response below to dev question) In the 2 seconds between my card selection & holding the watch to the reader, at times, it'll randomly change cards. My bookkeeper is not happy with this. Google wallet is what I'm using for the watch and my phone.
data.replyText: Sorry about that, Michael. In eligible countries, you can set up the Google Wallet app on supported watches. Learn more here https://goo.gle/3y9SjNL. If the issue persists, we can help you directly here: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: I'm joining the group that isn't able to add items to Google Wallet. When I open the app I get a download option. That option takes me to the Play Store, to the Google Wallet that I already have and it is as updated as the system indicates. All the instructions go around in circles. Either the options in the instructions do not work or there is no option. Great big flop.

Everything is great with this app, except.... a major security flaw is that the NFC feature on your phone does not automatically turn off after each use. As a networking and security professional, I can assure you that is a security risk! Same as the cards with the wireless feature. They can be read from a distance with the right equipment. The NFC feature of your phone should only be enabled while actively using the app. Period.

Being using this app since it's beginnings. Got the 8 Pro and every time I try to add a key I am getting a "Can't Pair" popup, this happenes seconds after opening the app. Tried uninstalling, clearing cache and data. Nothing works. Called customer service and was told to take it for repair. When to the store and they won't take a look unless I do a hard reset. Sincerely so disappointed having this issue.

It's not bad really. Very easy to use... Even if you're not the account's owner. And there lies the issue. The security for an app that deals with such sensitive information is appalling. You unlocked your phone? You unlocked the use of this app for anyone to use. It doesn't have a secondary lock, not even as an option, like banking apps have. You tapped into NFC? You payed. No confirmation request, nothing at all. NFC crimes are taking off and this app is their greatest allied.

Like I said, I rebooted several times. I faked to mention I cleared cache on every Google thing on my phone and installed reinstalled wallet. Nothing worked. Sent email to developer. [] I've been trying for several hours to set up wallet. It keeps notifying me that before I can choose an account to associate I need to allow all permissions in goggle play services which I have done and all Google related apps. I've rebooted several times but it's stuck. Please advise at your earliest convenience.
data.replyText: Sorry about that. Could you try clearing the app's cache, data and restart your phone to see if it works fine? If everything looks good but you still experience problems: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: This app used to be fine and now is completely useless. Every time I've gone to use it it has forgotten my cards and I've had to reset it up... So it only works. If you have your cards with you anyway. Useless. Then it works at most half of the time. Utterly and completely useless. Everything Google does gets less functional and works worse over time...
data.replyText: Sorry to hear that. Please let us know if you are referring to the Google Wallet or Google Pay app as well which country you're using the app in. This will help us understand how to best support you.

data.text: What a useless app. I can't add a credit card after trying dozens of times and I keep getting "Something Went Wrong" with no more details. There is no help anywhere as usual for any Google service. Just complete garbage. I have been in contact with customer service and after several attempts to fix the issue it still doesn't work. I give up and have deleted the app. Google apps and services have been on a downward spiral lately. Poor service, poor quality. Seems like the beginning of the end!
data.replyText: Sorry to hear that, Dan. Please let us know if you are referring to the Google Wallet or Google Pay app as well which country you're using the app in. This will help us understand how to best support you.

data.text: This app was great until it wasn't. I'm sure it's a setting that I have. But there's no instructions to fix my problem. It just will not work i've tried three different store locations, And it's not the easiest to troubleshoot because I need to be using it. Please help me with any settings that I might need to make sure that this works consistently. Google wallet, I have Uninstaller and reinstalled and will update on the success. Again hard to trouble shoot with folks waiting in line behind me.
data.replyText: Sorry about that, Luanne. Please let us know if you are referring to the Google Wallet or Google Pay app as well which country you're using the app in. This will help us understand how to best support you.

data.text: I agree with the reviews prior to mine. The interface leaves much to be desired. It's clunky at best. The app should not require the phone to be locked but rather the app itself. Threatening to remove my payment cards is counterintuitive. It makes me want to use the app less. They don't transfer from phone to phone anyway and always requires bank verification even though I have the physical card in front of me.

Honestly this app is such a pain to use. It's inconsistent. Half the time it says phone moved too fast, and/or asks you to re-verify via fingerprint. You never know when it'll happen. When it fails it tells you to try again, but it doesn't back you out to try again, you have to figure it out, press back, and then try again, and hope it works this time. Just make me use the fingerprint at the time of use (like Samsung) or, stop doing that. It's so annoying.

Cannot load Clipper Card for SF Bay Area Transit. A credit card would not load. Where is the place for medical cards. The User Interface leaves a lot to be desired. If Google could just really improve their User Interface on products such as this, they might actually dramatically improve their market share. I am using a Pixel 8 Pro, so the phone is not the problem. I would like to be able to load cards through my computer.

Either it is a bug, a very bad UX design, or a glaring missing feature. I do not seem to have the option to take a picture of a card and add it to my wallet. It seems to only want 9ne of the predefined types of cards and for those, it only has options for a predefined set of vendors. I want a card with a bar code from a local community center that is not in their database. I do not see a way to add it. Lame.

Overall the app is good but it has been buggy with the NFC recently. The first attempt fails requiring you to use your fingerprint. Sometimes this is right after I unlock the phone and bring up wallet. I would prefer being asked every time I open wallet. Just be consistent. Gets awkward trying to pay when it fails and the cashier has to restart the transaction.

I was enjoying Google Wallet, and after an update, it stopped working. It is so embarrassing when you are in line trying to pay. I never had issues with Apple Pay. I get an error stating your device doesn't meet security requirements. I did some research, cleared the cache etc, and it still does not work. So frustrating.
data.replyText: Sorry to hear that, Hilda. Check if your software is Play Protect certified: https://goo.gle/3OhaIyi. If you were previously able to tap with Google Wallet, reach out to your device manufacturer. There may have been a device software update that impacts functionality. Additional troubleshooting: https://goo.gle/3y7dKPA. Thanks!

data.text: Very glitchy and stops working for no reason very often so I need to restart my phone. Edit : I am in the UK and using Pixel 7 pro. Very often when traveling on the Tube the app will send an error message saying 'phone moved too fast' or it will simply not work. Very irritating and embarrassing when you are in a rush to catch a train or get to work. Usually restarting the phone seems to do the trick but don't want to have to do it every time.
data.replyText: Thanks for the update. Please check out this article to fix issues with the app: goo.gle/3b6hwwn. If the issue persists, we can help you directly here: http://goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: Unable to change default card any more, not good for changing the default card to pay with. Have submitted feedback via the app. Not good for people who travel a lot and need to change from travel tap cards to another card when home. Thanks for the reply, sadly this doesn't work - which is what the issue is. When you select a different card and then click on it before even getting the options, it just hangs with a spinning wheel. I have deleted all the caches and reset the app. Still broke.
data.replyText: Hi again. We are sorry that you continue to have this experience. In this case, we would encourage you to contact our support team directly: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Many greetings.

data.text: Like so many others here, the app was working as it should, until it wasn't. My bank and loyalty cards show in the list and can be selected, but don't transact when put close to the reader (in any orientation), with or without a phone case. I've uninstalled and reinstalled, rebooted - all the usual fixes. I thought it may have been my phone until I dug a little deeper. I'm still on a Pixel 4 running Android 13. Google Wallet app, Australia. 2 more updates, and still no good! What's going on?
data.replyText: Hi Peter! We are sorry to hear that you encountered issues using Google Wallet app. Please check out this article to fix issues with the app: http://goo.gle/3b6hwwn. If the issue persists, we can help you directly here: http://goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: It works but there's an annoying bug: unless you have your phone's Settings > Accessibility > Colour and Motion > Remove Animations switched OFF, Google Pay gives no visual indication that a payment has succeeded. The tick only shows when animation is ON, but I don't want animation on my entire phone. Also, an option shouldn't be called "remove X" such that the option being on means that X is off.

I've used this app for years, but the recent changes make it a nightmare to use, every time I open the wallet it asks me to add a new card and until I select it and then close the screen I can't access my cards, it causes so many issues when trying to pay for anything at a till, adding extra steps into what used to be a simple procedure, it's not user friendly at all, who tests these changes before they are implemented? I have also emailed support to fix
data.replyText: Sorry to hear that, Clare. Your cards can be deleted from Google Wallet if you change your Google Account password or turn off your screen lock. Learn more: http://goo.gle/3d5Mgmq. If this is not the case, it is best to contact our support for further assistance: http://goo.gle/38DqsZ0. Thanks!

data.text: My wallet has suddenly stopped working and have tried multiple attempts to resolved On my way to a gym class which I cannot get to and will be charged a £10 fee for a late cancel/no show, this is very annoying. Response - when putting phone with wallet open to a tap in at the train station barrier, or at the machine or at a card machine at the kiosk, just nothing happens. I tried both via 5G and WIFI, uninstalling and reinstalling but it just doesn't even seem to register that it's there.
data.replyText: Thanks for the update, Amber. Could you try clearing the app's cache, data and restart your phone to see if it works fine? If the issue persists, we can help you directly here: http://goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: It's just paid for something with account I opted not to connect as it's a joint account. Taken over the overdraft limit. can't find it to disconnect. I don't know if this is banking app mistake or Google wallet but the payment should have come out the one account I've always used. Theres enough credit in it. I've dragged myself into the 21st century and I wish I hadn't because of the inevitable gremlins

as other people have described, this app has recently behaved very unstable. no problems in the past, able to pay without issues. then getting an update (no changes to the phone whatsoever) and suddenly "phone does not meet security requirements". after that, only way to reset is to uninstall all updates from Google play services and clear all data from wallet, then reinsert all cards again. this works until a new update comes and breaks the whole thing again google you have to do something
data.replyText: Hello Daniel, we are sorry that you continue to have this experience. In this case, we would encourage you to contact our support team directly: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Many greetings.

data.text: Just added a payment card to the app, that's where problems start, I can't use it. It's asking for a pin assume it's the card pin, nope it's incorrect, phone unlock pin nope it's incorrect. I wasn't asked to set a pin so am at a loss at how to use it. Added card via NFC. I'll stick with getting my card out of my pocket, less hoops to jump through and it's less hassle. Why are simple tasks made so complicated these days.

Like others say, excellent when it works, a right pain when it doesn't! I edited this review as I had issues, I tried the clear cache/ data/ reinstall etc which didn't work, but I contacted Google whose advice was spot on....an issue with the tokens from my bank...so contacted them too, they reissued the tokens and all works now. In other words....use the help/chat/phone support options if u have issues. Very helpful!!
data.replyText: Hello Gavin, we are sorry that you continue to have this experience. In this case, we would encourage you to contact our support team directly: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Many greetings.

data.text: The tap pay has just stopped working, left me in an embarrassing situation as no bank card with me. I've checked everything, set up, security, nfc, latest version, everything is fine. It was working for a bit if I went via settings into the wallet rather than the shortcut but that's no longer working either. I remove the cache do a restart etc not fixed the issue. Google wallet basically now useless and its infuriating to me. Might move to Samsung pay as someone else mentioned. Pointless.
data.replyText: Hi Nina! We're sorry to hear that. Can you check these few steps and let us know if it helps? https://goo.gle/3y7dKPA. If everything looks good but you still experience problems: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks for reaching out.

data.text: Until recently I had no problem with the app, it was the easier way to pay contactless and being carefree. The last 2 weeks I'm facing problems, cards are not readable and that is not a card's problem. The app doesn't work properly and have to uninstall and install whenever I need to make a contactless payment. Please fix this error, it is probably due to an apps update that was made recently.
data.replyText: We're sorry to hear that, Marilena. Can you check these few steps? https://goo.gle/3y7dKPA. If everything looks good but you still experience problems, visit: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: Can no longer change default payment. Tried to delete cards and re-install. But the same cards are still there after installing again and I still can't change default payment. Used this for years without issues but now just does not work. In reply to your reply, yes that's what I used to be able to do, but you can no longer change to another card, when you select that card it's just loads a swirling circle but nothing happens. As per other people reporting the same thing in reviews.
data.replyText: Sorry about that, James. The 1st payment method you add to Google Wallet becomes your default for Tap to Pay. To change it, open the Google Wallet app, swipe until you find the card you want to use as default, tap the card, then details, then Make default for tap to pay. https://goo.gle/3ycWs3x. Thanks!

data.text: It used to be great before the recent update. And even before that, having to swipe around to select the card to use is frustrating. Now with the smaller carousel, it's downright upsetting because it swipes the wrong card. And if you've kept the app open, it wouldn't work if you want to use it again when your phone is unlocked. The UX and UI needs a more convenient upgrade for users.
data.replyText: Hi there! We are sorry that you continue to have this experience. In this case, we would encourage you to contact our support team directly: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Many greetings.

data.text: The carousel for payment cards is very annoying and cumbersome when standing at a till and trying to pay, since you have to swipe between each card individually. A simple list of cards would be much better, or at least a carousel that's faster and more responsive. Also the list of passes needs to be more compact so I don't have to scroll as much to find the right pass.

Always says "phone is moving too fast" as if my pixel8 has vertigo or something. You get the phone moving too fast error sometimes even if the phone is rested on the payment terminal without a case on the device. After you get this error you have to clear app cache and restart your device and by that time your train has left and you're late for work...again 😂 Fix your app Google, this is trash. Edit: it's trash, you added a "that didn't work" message instead of "phone is moving too fast"
data.replyText: Sorry about that, Nathan. Please let us know if you are referring to the Google Wallet or Google Pay app as well which country you're using the app in. This will help us understand how to best support you.

data.text: I much appreciate your willingness to help; however, the article is generic and trivial. All I'm saying is that Google should do better; I use your top handset, the system is always updated and I don't install dodgy apps. I'm starting to believe that switching to the competitor platform might be a sensible solution. My main issue with your ecosystem is that it works phenomenally if does at all. But if it doesn't it's hard to get any help.
data.replyText: Thanks for confirming. Please check out this article to fix issues with the app: goo.gle/3b6hwwn. If everything looks good but you still experience problems: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: When I try to use my Revolut card to enter TfL underground stations the app shows a big red ❗ saying that it couldn't be authorized. It didn't used to be a problem so I don't know if it's related to an update. It seems to be completely random. I tried to force stop the app but it doesn't help, that card is not recognized. I sometimes experience a similar issue with some terminals (in Tesco) but everywhere else it works so I don't think it's my phone.
data.replyText: Thanks for the update, Viktor. Could you try clearing the app's cache, data and restart your phone to see if it works fine? If the issue persists, we can help you directly here: http://goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: EDIT - "As with other reviews you have copy and pasted the generic reply below to, there is clearly a bug when loading the required screens to change the default. We have been using the approach to change default payments for a long time, but now it just gets stuck on loading the settings screen and hence no way to change. Please report this to the developers and address, thank you!" Usually a fantastic app, however, as others have mentioned - cannot change default payment since an app update
data.replyText: Sorry to hear that, Michael. The 1st payment method you add to Google Wallet becomes your default for Tap to Pay. To change it, open the Google Wallet app, swipe until you find the card you want to use as default, tap the card, then details, then Make default for tap to pay. https://goo.gle/3ycWs3x. Hope this helps!

data.text: Honestly as other people mentioned recently, it is very unstable lately both on POS machines and touching it on tube etc. It is honestly very frustrating being in a queue and having to restart the phone (the only solution that works for me) as people are waiting for you to pay. Quite an embarrassing experience. I cannot believe how Google cannot get this feature right conpared to iOS that seemingly never fails (according to my peers). Honestly has made me consider moving platforms.

This app has become glitchy. If I don't glide it in at the right speed and angle to tap on to public transport or merchant machine, it says I moved too fast. Then it doesn't work at all. Sometimes, it may work for a little while, but its performance degrades, then stops. I tried in different machines and shops, all the same result. The only way to fix it i have found is to reinstall and restart the phone. I have done the diagnostic for the NFC, and it says it's fine. It was a good app before.
data.replyText: Sorry to hear that, Lachlan. In this case, we would encourage you to contact our support team directly: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Many greetings.

data.text: Incredible that you can't just turn it off. Only way to disable the wallet is to go into settings and disable NFC. Great app and easy to use, for sure, but it's absolutely unthinkable that it has to be always active when it's installed and there's no way to just turn it off. Maddening even that the wallet is included in the tiles of the quick settings menu (swipe down from the top) but it's not actually a toggle, just a shortcut.

Confirmation of price is never available. Everytime I have to pay for something, sellers just show me the back of the machine in order to connect with the phone NFC. Often I have to confirm with fingerprint or password. This is the moment when, not only we should confirm it's "me" using it, but also be sure that the seller typed the correct price amount so I don't have any surprises later. That would be a great feature to be added.

Using this primarily for passes/loyalty cards. Basic functionality seems ok, although in some cases it scans the barcode wrong if the barcode is a little scuffed. But there's a giant box asking me to add payment cards on the main screen taking up valuable real estate that I can't dismiss. Rearranging the order of cards is super difficult, it doesn't consistently move the other cards over as I drag. Would be great to be able to add a homescreen directly to a specific card for quick access.

Doesn't allow you to require fingerprint to pay (secured by phone screen lock(s) only, which may be less secure). Can pay in some countries when the screen is locked, making it prone to skimming, but the option to turn that off is in the phone settings not the app settings, and not all phone's have that setting. The limit of these payments can be quite high in don't counties. This makes it less secure than physical contactless cards, which you can at least block with a RFID blocking wallet.

The latest version asks me to verify myself for EVERY purchase. Even if I unlock my phone it still asks for verification which is extremely annoying because it happens after I try to pay. once I do pass verification I try to tap again and some EFTPOS devices crack the sads and ask for the card to be inserted. Or the transaction has to be cancelled and start again. This is not making payments easier.

My card just got randomly removed from my wallet with no warning or email to say from Google. And then when I try to add it back, it says it can't and to contact my issuer. Obviously the issuer allows for contactless since it was on there before. The card is in date and still active, as I can see that it has been activated on my banks app. So stupid. Randomly was removed one day and now I can't use it at all. It's my main card.
data.replyText: Sorry about that, Bronwyn. Your cards can be deleted from Google Wallet if you change your Google Account password or turn off your screen lock. Learn more: goo.gle/3d5Mgmq. If this is not the case, it is best to contact our support for further assistance: goo.gle/38DqsZ0. Our specialists will be happy to help you in the best possible way. Thanks!

data.text: It has been so good and reliable for such a long time that we forgot how disruptive it is when broken. Which it is over the last week or so at least. Both for me and my wife. Again as mentioned by other reviewers, massive problem trying to use it on entry/exit barriers at tube and train. Absolute nightmare. Edit in response to developer query: We are in the UK, using the Google Wallet app. One of us has a Samsung 22 Ultra, the other the Pixel 8.
data.replyText: Thanks for confirming. Here are a few common issues and recommendations on how to fix them. https://goo.gle/3y9nLfi. If everything looks good but you still experience problems: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: Used to work well on my Google pixel 6, now on my new pixel 8, tapping in and out of TfL is a massive issue and only works on the third attempt. Very very inconvenient. *Edit: I have tried the suggestions posted below and they do not help. I have also been in touch with support and they offer me no help. This is clearly a wider issue with Google wallet.
data.replyText: Hi Alex! We are sorry to hear that you are having issues using Google Wallet to purchase and use transportation tickets. Here are a few common issues and recommendations on how to fix them: https://goo.gle/3y9nLfi. If everything looks good but you still experience problems: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks for reaching out.

data.text: The app has recently come up with an error. There was a problem setting up an active account. The app worked fine before, now it won't open at all. Tried to uninstall and reinstall. Nothing seems to work at all. Very frustrated. The app is Google Wallet and I'm in the UK. Using a Samsung S23 Ultra. If you need any more details please ask. I have edited the report and no one has answered. I have tried Google Support twice and have had no answer to the problem. They ask the same things no answer.
data.replyText: We are sorry to hear that, Christopher. Please check out this article to fix issues with the app: goo.gle/3b6hwwn. If everything looks good but you still experience problems, visit: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks for reaching out.

data.text: Like many others have reported, the wrong merchant name regularly shows up in the app (often neighbouring merchants), and there is no way to give feedback. Ultimately they are correct on the back statement so all is good. But for a payment processing app, I expect it to be a bit more accurate! Don't rely on it.

Good app and very useful as it makes payments faster and more convenient. It would be better if the following features were added. I hope Google will take note: 1. Money transfer by tapping two phones together would be convenient for individuals and small shops without a POS machine. 2. Support for quick money transfer via QR code through Google Wallet without the need to open the bank app. 3. Support for adding cards by tapping instead of having to enter manually. 4. Support for other NFCs

Frustrating and great at the same time. Pretty much anytime I use it I have to first attempt to use it and get the transaction rejected because I need to use my fingerprint to unlock the card. I then unlock the card and I can then use the wallet. This can sometimes cause difficulty for the merchant because occasionally they also have to reset the transaction. If the card is locked, prompt me to unlock it right up front. There is no way to unlock it proactively before the transaction fails.

I tried the app 2 months ago and did not like it due to the lack of security. I use Samsung wallet instead, so every time I make a Tap purchase I have to use a finger print to unlock the ability to tap. Google wallet does not do this. So if someone gets your phone, they can have a great of shopping. No thank you. Google do better and maybe I'll switch.

Cards keep disappearing since over a week ago, incl. a transport card that had some money in it. Contacted Google Support multiple times but they kept saying that they are doing the best they can and it would be fixed "soon". No progress it seems. Based in Australia. To developer's response: I have. Wrote this review as the last step.
data.replyText: Sorry about that. Your cards can be deleted from Google Wallet if you change your Google Account password or turn off your screen lock. Learn more: goo.gle/3d5Mgmq. If this is not the case, it is best to contact our support for further assistance: goo.gle/38DqsZ0. Our specialists will be happy to help you in the best possible way.

data.text: Since the last update the app is unusable for credit card transactions. To the support team: Yes, I've tried all the 'fixes', yes I've contacted the support team and they were also unable to help. They *said* they would refer the issue to the developers but who knows. No idea when the fix will be rolled out but will now be using another payment app.

Google Wallet has stopped working. When I click on the app, it shows a dialogue box that says, "There is a problem with setting the active account." What mysterious account is it referring to? I only have one Google account. Have tried re-installing, deleting cache and data, but nothing seems to work. Have stopped using it and uninstalled it, which is a shame as it was a useful app.
data.replyText: Hi Gavin! We are sorry to hear that you encountered issues using Google Wallet app. Please check out this article to fix issues with the app: http://goo.gle/3b6hwwn. If the issue persists, we can help you directly here: http://goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: My NFC is always off but when I use Samsung Wallet to pay, it automatically switches on to do the payment and off after it. Google Wallet should do the same, instead of telling me to turn it on manually. That's why I prefer the aforementioned one, and it also lacks of rewards or points in every purchase like Samsung has. Hope it can add the UAE transit passes.

Its stoped working on my Samsung phone since latest update. Google wallet. In the UK. It has stopped working. None of the cards could be tapped. Tried in numerous places, on the tube, restaurant, shops. Had to give in. Moved it all to Samsung pay instead which worked! Update...I had already done all that..made no difference, hence why I've moved to use a different app.
data.replyText: Thanks for the update. Could you try clearing the app's cache, data and restart your phone to see if it works fine? If the issue persists, we can help you directly here: http://goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: keeps crashing on my phone. Google apps in general crash on my Samsung phone. Phone becomes slow. Phone app and emails don't work. Have to restart phone everytime to clear the errors. Am sick of it. Living in Ireland. Both Google wallet and pay apps can cause the fault. But other google apps can crash also from time to time. Once the fault happens no Google apps will work properly. Nor will a lot of my other apps. I HAVE TRIED EVERYTHING TO FIX. NOTHING FIXES IT. NOTHING!!
data.replyText: Thanks for the update. Could you try clearing the app's cache, data and restart your phone to see if it works fine? If everything looks good but you still experience problems: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: Keeps nagging me about permissions - specifically the "Telephone" When I go through the settings there are NO restrictions at all. Clear cache doesn't help. The only issue would be that I don't have "Telephone" in my settings. I have "Phone" - anyhow, useless since I can't even register my credentials.

Make the view of cards scale correctly for fold phones, it's cut off. Everything on the app is huge and doesn't fit correctly. Utilise the space, such as cards on the right, settings on the left. When devices are folded out, have an indicator on what side is the NFC reader, it's easy to forgot when the device is folded out, as it looks like one whole device from users perspective. Additionally, have Material U added.

It was working absolutely fine until all of the sudden stopped working. It says that 'my phone doesnt meet the security requirements'. However nothing has changed since last time I used it and the funny thing is that now and then the app shows that my phone MEET the security requirements until all again the same thing. Edit; I live in Spain and I have never had problems before. The problems are with Google Wallet only (that is why the review is here!)
data.replyText: Thanks for the update. Check if your software is Play Protect certified. https://goo.gle/3OhaIyi. If you were previously able to tap with Google Wallet, reach out to your device manufacturer. There may have been a device software update that impacts functionality. Additional troubleshooting: https://goo.gle/3y7dKPA. Thanks!

data.text: It worked faultlessly before the last update. (PIXEL PRO 7) I've uninstalled it and cleared the data but it still won't work. Can't even turn on NFC!! Google. Please update this URGENTLY?! I'm in the UZk and it happens every time I try to use Google Wallet 😮‍💨😵. Tried the fix and still doesn't work. 🤷🏻‍♂️ Think my NFC is on the blink there is no option to turn it on or off in my settings.
data.replyText: Hi Browton. We're sorry to hear that. Can you check these few steps and let us know if it helps? https://goo.gle/3y7dKPA. If the issue persists, we can help you directly here: http://goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: Like many others the app stopped working for me half the time to being completely useless now. From phone moving too quickly to completely unresponsive when held up to the contact less scanner. Tried clearing cache, updating and reinstalling the app multiple times, the first reinstall completely broke the app for me. EDIT: Using Google wallet in UK
data.replyText: Thanks for confirming. In this case, we would encourage you to contact our support team directly: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: Just won't work with a single card (too bad it's my primary card for payments)- even though the same Google wallet on the same phone works with other cards just fine. Same card that's not working on Google wallet on the pixel 8 pro is working just fine using the same Google account on the Samsung a52s. What an absolute shambles from Google, customer support won't go further than requesting to remove and add one's card again (which obviously doesn't help). edit: now won't work with any card

Constantly get the error message saying my device doesn't meet the security standards. Using a galaxy s23 ultra with everything updated. Loosing confidence in the app. Also had 3 transactions declined at the terminal only to be changed a few days later for the transactions. Luckily they were a small amount (coffee) hi. It's Google wallet in the UK.
data.replyText: Thanks for confirming. Check if your software is Play Protect certified. https://goo.gle/3OhaIyi. If you were previously able to tap with Google Wallet, reach out to your device manufacturer. There may have been a device software update that impacts functionality. Additional troubleshooting: https://goo.gle/3y7dKPA. Thanks!

data.text: Absolutely disgusted with this app at the moment. As others have said, the app has failed to keep my card details on the screen, and when I go to use it, the stores machine comes up with the word error in red. I have removed and reinstalled my card, uninstalled and reinstalled the app, and it is still not working. My rating will not change until the app is fixed. PS. This app was working fine before the last update. I am using the google Wallet app, and I'm in Australia.
data.replyText: We are sorry to hear that, Stephen. In this case, we would encourage you to contact our support team directly: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks for reaching out.

data.text: Horrible. Half of the time does not read. Google Wallet used in the UK. Says phone moved too fast. The phone is not even moving. Then does not try to reread and freezes on that message. I have to come out of the app and back in to retry. Over and over. It's embarrassing when you are holding the line. Going back to using contactless card.
data.replyText: Thanks for the update, Vitor. Could you try clearing the app's cache, data and restart your phone to see if it works fine? If the issue persists, we can help you directly here: http://goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: Like others, Google Wallet has become useless in the past few months when it comes to using it in the UK with any transport. It starts with "moved too quickly" and after 2-3 of those, completely blocks both my app and the terminal I am trying to use it at. A restart used to fix it for a few days so I was restarting my phone every 3 days but that's stopped helping too and now it goes straight to "moved too quickly" immediately after reset. Changing apps as this is not practical. (Samsung Flip 4)
data.replyText: Thanks for confirming. Could you try clearing the app's cache, data and restart your phone to see if it works fine? If everything looks good but you still experience problems: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: Worse than Google Pay! Loyalty card icons are HUGE and only 5 can fit to a page. Make the icons smaller so that we can quickly select a card without scrolling through multiple pages. And how about keeping a record of transactions for at least a month so that they can be readily reconciled against bank statements, otherwise there is no point in storing each activity statement. New problem - credit card did not update when expired an replaced with new. Tried to delete credit card, but on tapping

Google Wallet stopped working, now have to reinstall every time I want to use my contactless card. The contactless symbol appears very small below the card, rather than large and above. I know them that it won't work and I have to reinstall. It then works for about 24hrs before I have to repeat the process after removing and reinstalling. Tried the suggestions of clearing cache, data and restarting. Stops working after 24 hours without fail!
data.replyText: Thanks for the update, Jon. Could you try clearing the app's cache, data and restart your phone to see if it works fine? If the issue persists, we can help you directly here: http://goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: The recent update to the Google wallet has made using this app in the UK so difficult. It's now very difficult to open the app and get to a card. When I use the tube, it's so slow accessing a payment card and half the time it doesn't register at the ticket gate. This causes real issues with other computers stuck waiting behind you. I'm now looking for an alternative app, as I'm fed up of the embarrassment the updated Google wallet app causes.
data.replyText: Hi Charlie! We are sorry to hear that you encountered issues using Google Wallet app. Please check out this article to fix issues with the app: goo.gle/3b6hwwn. If everything looks good but you still experience problems: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: Quite like latest update, before that you'd payment cards in your face as soon as you opened the wallet. Can't move the sequence of the cards but it's easy to scroll them across (before you could but anyway it didn't work). 🤞 Wish fingerprint was needed to open the wallet, more security that it can't be read by people near you, smaller icons for reward store-cards & that I could customise colours writing ... Overall it's quite nice now & always worked well. 💪

Update: I found out my card scanned incorrectly and I've been getting a random person HUNDREDS OF DOLLARS IN POINTS. Why is the scan so fast and incorrect sometimes. You always have to double check to make sure your card number is correct. I just lost so many point omg. This is referring to Google Wallet rewards cards in Canada. Scans too quickly, which causes it to scan incorrectly. That's a big issue because I don't know if my cards are even correct anymore.
data.replyText: Sorry about that, Alan. Please let us know if you are referring to the Google Wallet or Google Pay app as well which country you're using the app in. This will help us understand how to best support you.

data.text: Security concern. If your phone is stolen from your hand when unlocked, thieves can easily just start tapping your phone and make purchases. I urge Google to add a second layer of security so that even if the phone is unlocked and NFC on, you should need to scan your finger print before a payment can be made. This is the way Apple do it and it's much secure. I do not feel safe storing cards on Google wallet due to this. And now more than ever thieves are snatching phones and driving off. Unsafe.

Google Wallet was working perfectly for some months after switching over from Google Play but all of a sudden I get an error saying my device is possibly rooted or running uncertified software. I was unable to buy my groceries because of this. What an awful "feature" that just harms people who don't modify their device. Edit: I've been able to resolve the issue thanks to the devs' comments
data.replyText: Sorry about that. Could you try clearing the app's cache, data and restart your phone to see if it works fine? If the issue persists, we can help you directly here: http://goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: Worked everywhere I've tried to use it. Be it Lidl or Tube station. Also you can save your train tickets on it (granted i never do), theatre tickets which are easy enough to add (granted this us only if given the option). Sometimes it says I've moved my phone too fast but just give it second and try again or reopen the app. Shame I can't put all my cards on it granted this is likely partly to blame on the banks as well. With that said I use it all the time now. Pretty good.

The Google Wallet app itself is great, nicely designed, easy to set up and use, lots of convenient features. My bank (CIBC), however, charges me $2 for every transaction I make using the app so I tend to rarely use it if I have my actual credit & debit cards on me. Hopefully this egregious gouging will change if enough people complain. But until then, I will not give them the satisfaction.

The digital key function does not work on the Pixel 8 Pro. Why was this left of the Google flagship phone when plenty of other phones have it. I've spent a lot of money upgrading to the latest phone but it doesn't do all that my old phone did. Very poor show Google. For clarity this worked fine on my Google 6 Pro but the function is not currently available on the Google 8 Pro. What an amazingly unhelpful and inaccurate response from Google. I think they like to add insult to injury.
data.replyText: Sorry about that, Tim! Digital car keys are available for selected vehicles. They work with the Pixel 6, Pixel 6 Pro and selected Android devices that run Android 12. You can read more about how to set up or manage a digital car key in this article: goo.gle/3yff8zx. For further assistance: goo.gle/38DqsZ0. Thanks.

data.text: Used to work very well but it's bugged since Android 14 update. I received 2 updates so far and nothing changed, the problem was not addressed at all. When you launch it from the blocked screen with the shortcut it simply won't open. Hello, couldn't find the answer button, so I add here. yes, the problem is with the wallet app, from the shortcut on the blocked screen. When I tap on the wallet shortcut and unblock my phone the app doesn't open anymore it goes to home. Google Pixel8 Pro Canada
data.replyText: That’s not the experience we want you to have. In this case, we would encourage you to contact our support team directly: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Many greetings.

data.text: This app works well but the security of Google Pay is terrible which really holds it back. Firstly, there are no options to set up a pin or to even use my fingerprint or anything to secure the app when making payments (like a Apple Pay), I've looked in the Wallet app settings and there's nothing. Also, I don't even need to unlock my device to use this app which is a big security risk because if I lose my phone someone could easily make payments through it from my bank account.

When near reader, it doesn't work!!!! I place it near the reader, (the card)and it doesn't work. The reader accepts other cards from other mobile phones. It's an issue regarding my Wallet. It would be better if you fix this immediately cause it's causing such trouble and inconvenience!
data.replyText: Thanks for the update. Can you check these few steps and let us know if it helps? https://goo.gle/3y7dKPA. If everything looks good but you still experience problems: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: Mobile contactless on TFL very very rarely works. Works in shops, on trains but not on busses. Sometimes shows up "multiple cards used" or something along the lines, but I don't want to have to delete all stored cards just so I'm able to use one, then re add a different card I need to use and delete the rest. Needs a fix ASAP, don't know if it's part tfl problem or not - Edit: it is on Google wallet and I'm in the UK, thanks!
data.replyText: Thanks for confirming. The 1st payment method you add to Google Wallet becomes your default for Tap to Pay. To change it, open the Google Wallet app, swipe until you find the card you want to use as default, tap the card, then details, then Make default for tap to pay. https://goo.gle/3ycWs3x. Thanks!

data.text: Completely broken in the UK as of latest update (Jan 25, 2024). Unable to use any card, trying to add a card results in "card not supported by NFC" despite the card working fine on it's own. For anyone with the same issue, it can be fixed by uninstalling, which only uninstalls updates, reverting the app back to the version that was preloaded on your device. Remember to disable auto-updates in the Play Store after.

I'm in Australia using Google wallet on Samsung Android. I cannot delete my expired credit card nor can I add my new credit card. The app is supposed to have options in the top left but they don't exist only feedback which is useless. I have the latest version installed and have deleted the app and reinstalled numerous times with no success. Can support please rectify this issue.
data.replyText: Sorry to hear that, Craig. To troubleshoot issues with adding your card, please visit https://goo.gle/3Ia2gzm. If everything looks good but you still experience problems: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: Irritating since you cannot add pdfs etc to wallet. Yet lots of venues, or shop etc issue their tickets, voichers etc as pdfs. So far from being able to store all your tickets, passes etc as Google boast, it is only actually able to store some of them. Not good. Time you fixed your app to enable storage of pdfs Google, then it would be 5 star.

As with other reviews, app doesn't work for me - it maybe works once, then errors out with "moved too fast", and only works again if I completely uninstall and reinstall the app, and uninstall and reinstall my card which I shouldn't have to do for every payment. Since latest app update it doesn't seem to work at all. I've only just moved from Samsung phone to a Google Pixel Pro so this is super disappointing.
data.replyText: Sorry about that, Jess. Please let us know if you are referring to the Google Wallet or Google Pay app as well which country you're using the app in. This will help us understand how to best support you.

data.text: Until recently was working great. No problems. The other day though went to pay and my default card (which had been there for months) had been removed and not by my doing. I have also just changed phones I was using a Huawei Mate 20 and have just recently updated to using Pixel 7 Pro. Having great difficulty adding (and saving) my cards. I have also tried on multiple occasions to pay using Google pay and just will not recognise the NFC (which is configured and on). Based in Australia 😥
data.replyText: Thanks for confirming. To troubleshoot issues with adding your card, please visit https://goo.gle/3Ia2gzm. If everything looks good but you still experience problems: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: (EDITED.) Recent reviews aren't misleading. After realizing I'd accidentally left my card at home, my housemate sent me a picture of it so I could use Google Wallet. Problem solved, right? No; the EFTPOS machine didn't recognize the phone/card three times at the pharmacy, nor at the grocery store. EDIT: I'm clueless as to why the app could add my card just fine but didn't function on first installation; after reinstalling and troubleshooting, nothing seems to have changed but it works now.
data.replyText: Sorry to hear that, Shae. Can you check these few steps and let us know if it helps? https://goo.gle/3y7dKPA. If the issue persists, we can help you directly here: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Thanks!

data.text: Latest update has a bug - as I can't see history for some payment card. The problem is the fact that from the "history" menu you can set it as default. So the problematic cards cannot be set as default anymore. Tried reinstalling the app. Clear data/clear cache. Restarting the phone. Nothing works - seems like a server side issue. I cannot even delete and re-add the cards as the "delete" option is also under history ..
data.replyText: Hello Valentin, we are sorry that you continue to have this experience. In this case, we would encourage you to contact our support team directly: goo.gle/3Q7Hcg7. Many greetings.

data.text: The recent update has been catastrophic for ease of use. I've been stranded on a few occasions where the payment won't register. The response is usually 'phone moved too fast' but I'm not doing anything different to what I've done for the past couple of years. It's embarrassing being that person at the front of the line for the Tube in rush hour or on the bus.
data.replyText: Sorry to hear that, Giles. Please let us know if you are referring to the Google Wallet or Google Pay app as well which country you're using the app in. This will help us understand how to best support you.

data.text: About half the time, my phone will vibrate and beep as it does when the tap to pay device recognizes it, but it will ask me to authenticate again even though I ALWAYS unlock my phone and pull up Wallet before trying to use it to pay. This causes the tap to pay device to need to time out on the first failure before I can try to pay a second time. Google Pay app was so much better. Never had these issues with it.

Recent update has made it impossible to use my cards. Sometimes it works sometimes it doesn't. On public transport it says "phone moved too fast" which is not the case. Even when I restart my phone it doesn't fix it. I've looked everywhere online to fix it and nothing helps. A link on how to fix this won't help, the app is BUGGED Google.
data.replyText: Sorry about that, Piotr. Please let us know if you are referring to the Google Wallet or Google Pay app as well which country you're using the app in. This will help us understand how to best support you.

data.text: Fire the PM! Sloppy UX! If en error occurs, it's stuck on the silly error animation instead of letting me try again or pick another card. Also, you can't make it disabled or PIN protected when not in foreground. If your phone is open on another app, someone can clutch a simple machine and charge you. And please don't tell me I should disable NFC and enable it just before I wanna use the app.
